equationgroup.p:
In terms of vector projection of
V
on
R
,
V
can be described as

V ∥
is parallel to
R
and
V ⟂
is perpendicular to
R

Similarly,
V ′
can be described as

Math.text: V ^ prime = (V ^ prime) _ parallel-to + (V ^ prime) _ perpendicular-to
V ^ prime = V _ parallel-to + (V ^ prime) _ perpendicular-to

equationgroup.p:
V
and
R
are known quantities.
⟂
V ′
can be calculated by observing that in the plane perpendicular to R,
V ′
⟂
is
V ⟂
rotated by
θ
around R. This rotation can be described in the plane that is perpendicular to R

V ⟂
and
B
and are two mutually perpendicular plane vectors. Along with
R
they describe a coordinate frame,
⟂ V
⁢ B R
that can be used to compute
V ′
⟂
and consequently the complete equation for rotation of
V

Since cross product distributes over vector subtraction and since
V ∥
and
R
are parallel

Math.text: B = R * V - R * V _ parallel-to
absent = R * V - R * V _ parallel-to

equationgroup.p:
Using
V ⟂
and
B
as basis vectors,
V ′
⟂
can be written as

Math.text: (V ^ prime) _ perpendicular-to = V _ perpendicular-to * c * o * s * theta + R * V * s * i * n * theta
absent = V _ perpendicular-to * c * o * s * theta + R * V * s * i * n * theta

equationgroup.p:
Substituting
⟂
V ′
from (6) and
B
from (10), the final equation for
V ′
in terms of
V
and
R
is

para.p: A column-major rotation matrix is of the form

The columns
⁢ B 1
,
⁢ B 2
, and
⁢ B 3
are the coordinates of the basis vectors after rotation. To derive the rotation matrix for rotating
V
and producing
V ′
, we start with the basis vectors of the right-handed coordinate system
We first rotate these basis vectors using the rotation equation (12), and to form the rotation matrix, we add the rotated coordinates of the basis vectors to the rotation matrix
Substituting x-axis in equation , we get

Math.tex: \displaystyle V^{\prime}=\begin{vmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1\\ 0\\ 0\\ \end{bmatrix}-\begin{vmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1\\ 0\\ 0\\ \end{bmatrix}.\begin{bmatrix}R_{x}\\ R_{y}\\ R_{z}\\ \end{bmatrix}\end{vmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}R_{x}\\ R_{y}\\ R_{z}\\ \end{bmatrix}\end{vmatrix}cos\theta+\begin{vmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}R_{x}\\ R_{y}\\ R_{z}\\ \end{bmatrix}\times\begin{bmatrix}1\\ 0\\ 0\\ \end{bmatrix}\end{vmatrix}sin\theta
Math.text: V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[formulae@(matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]), matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]]))]])) * matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]])]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]]) * matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]])]])) * s * i * n * theta

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[formulae@(matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]), matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]]))]])) * matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]])]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]]) * matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]])]])) * s * i * n * theta

V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[R _ x * matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]])]]))]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[R _ x * matrix@(Array[[R _ x], [R _ y], [R _ z]])]]))]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta

V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(R _ x) ^ 2], [- R _ x * R _ y], [R _ x * R * z]]))]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[matrix@(Array[[1], [0], [0]]) - determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(R _ x) ^ 2], [- R _ x * R _ y], [R _ x * R * z]]))]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta
V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[1 - (R _ x) ^ 2], [- R _ x * R _ y], [- R _ x * R * z]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta
absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[1 - (R _ x) ^ 2], [- R _ x * R _ y], [- R _ x * R * z]])) * c * o * s * theta + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z], [- R _ y]])) * s * i * n * theta

V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(1 - (R _ x) ^ 2) * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta]])) + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(1 - (R _ x) ^ 2) * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta]])) + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(1 - (R _ x) ^ 2) * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta]])) + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[(1 - (R _ x) ^ 2) * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta]])) + determinant@(matrix@(Array[[0], [R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

V ^ prime = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[c * o * s * theta - (R _ x) ^ 2 * c * o * s * theta], [(- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta) + R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta - R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

absent = determinant@(matrix@(Array[[c * o * s * theta - (R _ x) ^ 2 * c * o * s * theta], [(- R _ x * R _ y * c * o * s * theta) + R _ z * s * i * n * theta], [- R _ x * R * z * c * o * s * theta - R _ y * s * i * n * theta]]))

para.p: Substituting y-axis in equation , we get
